title: http: Incorrect url building
body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
I don't have any post on this matter, so I will describe the whole case here.


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
The `operations/copyfile` command in `rclone` appears to concatenate the `srcRemote` URL incorrectly when an initial slash is included, resulting in an error.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
- `1.68.2`
- `master` branch

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
http


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
# Description: This script is used to run rclone in the background
rclone rcd --rc-web-gui --rc-web-gui-no-open-browser --rc-no-auth

# Create http configuration file
curl -X POST http://localhost:5572/config/create \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '
{
  "name": "http",
  "type": "http",
  "parameters": {
    "url": "https://noaa-ghcn-pds.s3.amazonaws.com"
  }
}'

# Create local configuration file
curl -X POST http://localhost:5572/config/create \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '
{
  "name": "local",
  "type": "local",
  "parameters": {}
}'

# Copy file from http to local
# Doesn't work with the initial slash
curl -X POST http://localhost:5572/operations/copyfile \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '
{
  "srcFs": "http:",
  "dstFs": "local:",
  "srcRemote": "/csv.gz/1763.csv.gz",
  "dstRemote": "/tmp/1763.csv.gz"
}'

# Copy file from http to local
# Works without the initial slash
curl -X POST http://localhost:5572/operations/copyfile \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '
{
  "srcFs": "http:",
  "dstFs": "local:",
  "srcRemote": "csv.gz/1763.csv.gz",
  "dstRemote": "/tmp/1763.csv.gz"
}'

# P.S. Links to the file:
# https://noaa-ghcn-pds.s3.amazonaws.com/csv.gz/1763.csv.gz
```
